claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination can broaden tumor antigen presentation and increase immune visibility.

evidence.quote: Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Mechanistic readouts were not uniformly strong across all tested model systems, so effect size may vary by context.

claims.claim: The treatment strategy induces type I interferon-associated signaling and increases PD-L1 pathway activity, supporting combination with checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: The report emphasizes that some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific models rather than universal across all settings.

claims.claim: Combination of intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 produced stronger antitumor immune signatures than controls in the preclinical murine arm.

evidence.quote: Preclinical arm: multiple murine tumor models with intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 combinations.
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy

claims.caveat: Response-level details and statistical analyses for each model are not fully enumerated in the summary, limiting certainty about magnitude across tumors.

claims.claim: Vaccinated metastatic patients showed an associated survival advantage under ICI treatment compared with unvaccinated patients in the retrospective cohort.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.caveat: Because the cohort analysis is non-randomized with variable vaccination timing and treatment heterogeneity, causality cannot be inferred.
